info.title: Pipelinq CRM Register
info.description: Client Relationship Management register for the Pipelinq Nextcloud app. Manages clients, contacts, leads, requests, and pipelines.

x-openregister.description: CRM data model — thin client on OpenRegister, no own database tables

pipelinq.title: Pipelinq
pipelinq.description: Client Relationship Management register for Pipelinq — manages clients, contacts, leads, requests, and pipelines using Schema.org and vCard (RFC 6350) standards.

client.title: Client
client.summary: A client (person or organization) in the CRM
client.description: Represents a client entity — either a natural person or an organization. Mapped to Schema.org Person/Organization and vCard (RFC 6350) field conventions. Clients are the primary relationship entity in Pipelinq.

name.description: Full name of the person or organization (schema:name / vCard FN)

type.description: Entity type — person or organization (maps to schema:Person or schema:Organization)

contactsUid.description: Nextcloud Contacts UID linking this client to a vCard in the user's addressbook

contact.title: Contact
contact.summary: A contact person linked to a client
contact.description: Represents a contact person associated with a client organization. Properties align with vCard (RFC 6350) field conventions.

name.description: Full name of the contact person (vCard FN)

role.description: Job title or role within the organization (vCard ROLE)

client.description: UUID reference to the parent client object

contactsUid.description: Nextcloud Contacts UID linking this contact to a vCard in the user's addressbook

lead.title: Lead
lead.summary: A sales lead or business opportunity
lead.description: Represents a sales lead — a potential deal or business opportunity linked to a client. Tracks value, probability, pipeline stage, and lifecycle status. Mapped to Schema.org Demand.

client.description: UUID reference to the associated client

contact.description: UUID reference to the associated contact person

source.description: Origin of the lead (e.g., website, referral, cold-call, advertisement, event)

expectedCloseDate.description: Expected close date for the opportunity

assignee.description: Nextcloud user UID of the assigned sales representative

pipeline.description: UUID reference to the pipeline this lead is tracked in

stageOrder.description: Numeric position of the current stage in the pipeline

request.title: Request
request.summary: A service request (verzoek) — the pre-state of a case
request.description: Represents a client service request that may be converted to a case in Procest. Tracks status lifecycle, priority, assignment, and optional pipeline placement.

client.description: UUID reference to the associated client

contact.description: UUID reference to the associated contact person

status.description: Current status in the request lifecycle

assignee.description: Nextcloud user UID of the assigned handler

requestedAt.description: Date and time the request was submitted

pipeline.description: UUID reference to the pipeline this request is tracked in

stageOrder.description: Numeric position of the current stage in the pipeline

channel.description: Intake channel for the request (e.g., phone, email, website)

caseReference.description: UUID reference to the converted Procest case

pipeline.title: Pipeline
pipeline.summary: A pipeline defining stages for tracking leads or requests
pipeline.description: Represents a sales or service pipeline — an ordered list of stages through which leads or requests progress. Each pipeline targets a specific entity type (lead, request, or both). Mapped to Schema.org ItemList.

entityType.description: Which entity types this pipeline tracks

probability.description: Default win probability percentage for this stage (0-100)

isClosed.description: Whether this stage represents a closed/terminal state

isWon.description: Whether this closed stage represents a won/successful outcome. Only valid when isClosed is true.

color.description: CSS hex color for the stage (e.g., '#10B981')

isDefault.description: Whether this is the default pipeline for its entity type
